places.title: Grand Canyon National Park
places.address: South Rim Drive, Grand Canyon Village, AZ 86023
places.description: One of the world's most spectacular natural wonders. Experience breathtaking views, hiking trails, and the geological history spanning millions of years at this UNESCO World Heritage Site.

places.title: Sedona Red Rock Country
places.description: Mystical red sandstone formations create a stunning landscape perfect for hiking, jeep tours, and spiritual retreats. Known for its energy vortexes and world-class spas.

places.title: Antelope Canyon
places.description: A magnificent slot canyon known for its wave-like structure and light beams that shine down into openings in the canyon. One of the most photographed canyons in the Southwest.

places.title: Monument Valley
places.description: Iconic desert landscape featuring massive sandstone buttes rising from the valley floor. Sacred to the Navajo Nation and featured in countless Western films and advertisements.

places.title: Petrified Forest National Park
places.description: Home to one of the world's largest concentrations of petrified wood, plus colorful badlands, petroglyphs, and fossils. A journey through 225 million years of history.

places.title: Saguaro National Park
places.description: Protects our nation's largest cacti, the giant saguaro. These majestic plants are found only in the Sonoran Desert and can live for 150-200 years, growing up to 40 feet tall.

places.title: Horseshoe Bend
places.description: A dramatic 270-degree bend in the Colorado River, creating a horseshoe-shaped meander. This overlook offers stunning views 1,000 feet above the river and is a photographer's paradise.

places.title: Canyon de Chelly National Monument
places.description: Ancient ruins and rock art preserve the culture of early inhabitants. Spider Rock, an 800-foot sandstone spire, rises dramatically from the canyon floor in this sacred Navajo homeland.
